carousel_items: Take it as needed every 4 to 6 hours.
Benadryl can make you dehydrated, so avoid this side effect by drinking plenty of fluids.
Benadryl makes you tired, so take it before you go to sleep.
Don't take it with alcohol or other drugs that make you sleepy.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor. A different medication might work better for you long-term.
If you only have itchy or watery eyes, try using just an antihistamine eye drop.

basics.benefits_moa: Benadryl is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions. It also makes you sleepy.
basics.bottom_line: Benadryl is great for allergies, but curl up on the couch after taking it and get ready for a nap.
downsides: Benadryl makes you more tired than Claritin, Allegra, or Zyrtec.
You shouldn't drive after taking Benadryl until you know how it affects you.
Talk to a pediatrician before giving Benadryl to a child.
It can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use Benadryl.
Don't use Benadryl if you are breastfeeding.

downsides_processed.orig: Benadryl makes you more tired than Claritin, Allegra, or Zyrtec.
You shouldn't drive after taking Benadryl until you know how it affects you.
Talk to a pediatrician before giving Benadryl to a child.
It can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use Benadryl.
Don't use Benadryl if you are breastfeeding.

upsides: Benadryl is often better than other antihistamines at treating allergy symptoms and hives.
It can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
It makes you sleepy, so it'll help if your allergies are bothering you at night.
The effects wear off in 4 to 6 hours, so side effects don't last that long.
It comes as a tablet, capsule, liquid, and quick dissolving tablet.

upsides_processed.orig: Benadryl is often better than other antihistamines at treating allergy symptoms and hives.
It can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.
It makes you sleepy, so it'll help if your allergies are bothering you at night.
The effects wear off in 4 to 6 hours, so side effects don't last that long.
It comes as a tablet, capsule, liquid, and quick dissolving tablet.

drugs.one_liner: Treats allergy symptoms and helps you sleep.

userStories.tip: This will make me very drowsy so I only take it when I have no plans to go outside or drive.
It used to work fine for me as a sleep aid.  Now it gives me restless legs for an hour or two before I can fall asleep.
I take it 1 to 2 hours before bedtime. It helps me fall asleep, stay asleep, and get back to sleep if I do wake up. I am also more aware of my dreams when I take it.
Made me so wired that I had heart palpitations
It will make you sleep so do not take if you have something to do.
Puts me to sleep easily, but leaves me feeling groggy and foggy, and not very well rested. May be good for a red-eye flight, but at home I use melatonin instead.
In South Louisiana, fire ants are everywhere!!!!!  I take benadryl when I get some bites and it always helps the itching to stop.

I take 25 -50mg about 2 hours before bedtime. It works very well to put me asleep and help keep me there. I have no side-effects the next day.  I've taken these dosages almost everything night for over 2 years.
Definitely drowsy. Good once in a blue moon to help get to sleep, but feel less well rested in the morning than if I didn't take it at all.

drugs.name: Benadryl

off-label_indications.indication: Extrapyramidal disease (movement disorder) from antipsychotic medicine

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it as needed every 4 to 6 hours.
Benadryl can make you dehydrated, so avoid this side effect by drinking plenty of fluids.
Benadryl makes you tired, so take it before you go to sleep.
Don't take it with alcohol or other drugs that make you sleepy.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor. A different medication might work better for you long-term.
If you only have itchy or watery eyes, try using just an antihistamine eye drop.

risks_warnings.title: Overdose
risks_warnings.description: There are a variety of over-the-counter medications with the same ingredients as Benadryl. It's not safe to use more than one medication containing diphenhydramine (the ingredient in Benadryl) at the same time. Read package labels carefully to make sure you take the right dose of these medications.
risk_factors: Using other drugs with the same ingredients

description_processed.orig: There are a variety of over-the-counter medications with the same ingredients as Benadryl. It's not safe to use more than one medication containing diphenhydramine (the ingredient in Benadryl) at the same time. Read package labels carefully to make sure you take the right dose of these medications.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 years and older have a higher risk of side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Benadryl. Watch for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. The drowsiness caused by Benadryl can make you "unsteady" on your feet, leading to a higher chance of falls.

description_processed.orig: People age 65 years and older have a higher risk of side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Benadryl. Watch for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. The drowsiness caused by Benadryl can make you "unsteady" on your feet, leading to a higher chance of falls.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Benadryl can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Benadryl can lower your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Hyperactivity
risks_warnings.description: Benadryl makes adults sleepy, but it can have the opposite effect on children and make them very excited and active. Don't give Benadryl to children 6 years or younger unless told to do so by your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Benadryl makes adults sleepy, but it can have the opposite effect on children and make them very excited and active. Don't give Benadryl to children 6 years or younger unless told to do so by your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble urinating
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Benadryl have trouble urinating. Don't take it if you already have problems with urination.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Benadryl have trouble urinating. Don't take it if you already have problems with urination.

risks_warnings.title: Vision changes
risks_warnings.description: Benadryl can affect your vision and worsen certain types of glaucoma. If you have glaucoma, talk with your doctor before using Benadryl.

description_processed.orig: Benadryl can affect your vision and worsen certain types of glaucoma. If you have glaucoma, talk with your doctor before using Benadryl.

risks_warnings.title: Breastfeeding
risks_warnings.description: Benadryl passes into the breast milk of nursing mothers and can cause harm to newborn babies. Don't use Benadryl if you're breastfeeding.

description_processed.orig: Benadryl passes into the breast milk of nursing mothers and can cause harm to newborn babies. Don't use Benadryl if you're breastfeeding.

carousel_items: Take Unisom at bedtime as needed if you're 12 years of age or older.
Unisom can make you dehydrated, so avoid this side effect by drinking plenty of fluids.
Don't take it with alcohol or other drugs that make you sleepy.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor. A different medication might work better for you long-term.
Unisom comes in two different generic forms, doxylamine (Unisom SleepTabs) and diphenhydramine (other Unisom products). Both are antihistamines that help you sleep.

basics.benefits_moa: Unisom is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions. It also makes you sleepy.
basics.bottom_line: Unisom is a good over-the-counter medication for nighttime allergies.
downsides: Unisom makes you more tired than Claritin, Allegra, or Zyrtec.
You shouldn't drive after taking Unisom until you know how it affects you.
Talk to a pediatrician before giving Unisom to a child.
It can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use Unisom.
Don't use Unisom if you are breastfeeding.

It comes as a tablet, capsule, liquid, and quick dissolving tablet.

carousel_items: Epinephrine comes in an adult dose and child dose autoinjector. Know how to use the injector before you need it by practicing with the sample injector in the Epinephrine kit.

When needed, inject the entire amount of medicine into the upper, outer part of the thigh, through clothing if necessary. If the severe allergic reaction doesnt go away, the dose can be repeated with a second Epinephrine in 5 to 15 minutes.
It's best to get medical attention immediately, even though you gave the injection.
In overweight or obese people, including children, inject Epinephrine into the lower half of the thigh or calf.
Epinephrine is sensitive to light and air and will turn pink or brown if it goes bad. Dont inject the solution if its discolored or contains solid particles.
Any additional doses will need to be given by a doctor in a healthcare setting.

basics.benefits_moa: Epinephrine is like adrenaline. It relaxes muscles in your lungs and relieves spasm, wheezing, and shortness of breath that happens during a severe allergic reaction (anaphylaxis).
basics.bottom_line: Epinephrine is a life-saving medication for severe allergic reactions. Just make sure you know how to give an injection before it's needed.
downsides: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you may a greater risk of having side effects from Epinephrine.
You can only use 2 Epinephrine injections to treat a severe allergic reaction. If you need a 3rd dose, it'll have to be given by a doctor in a hospital or healthcare setting.
Injecting Epinephrine into body parts other than the upper/outer thigh can cause serious damage and may not treat your allergic reaction. Never, ever accidentally inject it into your hand.
You should keep two Epinephrine injectors that haven't expired yet with you at all times if you know you have severe allergies to insects, foods, drugs, or other products.

downsides_processed.orig: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you may a greater risk of having side effects from Epinephrine.
You can only use 2 Epinephrine injections to treat a severe allergic reaction. If you need a 3rd dose, it'll have to be given by a doctor in a hospital or healthcare setting.
Injecting Epinephrine into body parts other than the upper/outer thigh can cause serious damage and may not treat your allergic reaction. Never, ever accidentally inject it into your hand.
You should keep two Epinephrine injectors that haven't expired yet with you at all times if you know you have severe allergies to insects, foods, drugs, or other products.

upsides: Epinephrine is an easy-to-use automatic injector. Just place the injector on the upper/outer part of your thigh and press a button.
Can be used immediately to stop a life-threatening allergic reaction.
The Jr. dose is for children 33lbs to 66 lbs. Adults should use the standard Epinephrine.

upsides_processed.orig: Epinephrine is an easy-to-use automatic injector. Just place the injector on the upper/outer part of your thigh and press a button.
Can be used immediately to stop a life-threatening allergic reaction.
The Jr. dose is for children 33lbs to 66 lbs. Adults should use the standard Epinephrine.

drugs.one_liner: Emergency injection for severe allergic reactions.
drugs.name: Epipen

carousel_items_processed.orig: Epinephrine comes in an adult dose and child dose autoinjector. Know how to use the injector before you need it by practicing with the sample injector in the Epinephrine kit.

When needed, inject the entire amount of medicine into the upper, outer part of the thigh, through clothing if necessary. If the severe allergic reaction doesnt go away, the dose can be repeated with a second Epinephrine in 5 to 15 minutes.
It's best to get medical attention immediately, even though you gave the injection.
In overweight or obese people, including children, inject Epinephrine into the lower half of the thigh or calf.
Epinephrine is sensitive to light and air and will turn pink or brown if it goes bad. Dont inject the solution if its discolored or contains solid particles.
Any additional doses will need to be given by a doctor in a healthcare setting.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: An injection of epinephrine can cause a significant increase in blood pressure.

description_processed.orig: An injection of epinephrine can cause a significant increase in blood pressure.

risks_warnings.title: Emergency treatment
risks_warnings.description: Injecting Epinephrine is only part of the treatment for a severe allergic reaction. In addition to the one or two injections given by yourself or a family member, you'll need to get immediate medical attention.

description_processed.orig: Injecting Epinephrine is only part of the treatment for a severe allergic reaction. In addition to the one or two injections given by yourself or a family member, you'll need to get immediate medical attention.

risks_warnings.title: Wrong area of injection
risks_warnings.description: Epinephrine can only be injected into the upper/outer part of the thigh, or for obese individuals, the lower part of thigh or calf. Injecting Epinephrine in other areas of the body can cause serious injury and won't completely treat your allergic reaction.

description_processed.orig: Epinephrine can only be injected into the upper/outer part of the thigh, or for obese individuals, the lower part of thigh or calf. Injecting Epinephrine in other areas of the body can cause serious injury and won't completely treat your allergic reaction.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening heart problems or high blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you can have more side effects if you use Epinephrine. It can cause temporary worsening of chest pain and palpitations.

description_processed.orig: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you can have more side effects if you use Epinephrine. It can cause temporary worsening of chest pain and palpitations.

carousel_items: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

clock.tip: Works better if taken with a high-fat meal.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisone is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisone is a common oral corticosteroid that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

upsides: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Short-term use in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Long-term use in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.

upsides_processed.orig: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Short-term use in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Long-term use in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.

userStories.tip: I have taken Prednisone on and off as low dose therapy to control Lupus and MS, but it caused a sandpaper rash all over my arms and face so doctor terminated the treatment. Weight gain was a definite issue for me.
Made my foot cramp and fall asleep. Also blurred vision!

SO SO hard to come off of...autoimmune chronic inflammatory issue--the rebound effect is vicious, and coming off prednisone makes me suicidal and want to self harm. Staying on prednisone makes me retain water and become hyper irritable.
Caused weight loss, muscle wasting and thinning of the bones
Never take on an empty stomach. Take the lowest dosage that is effective.
It has many more side effects than it's worth.. : /

userStories.identifier: Parent, work out when I can

drugs.name: Prednisone

labeled_indications.indication: Cerebral edema from a brain tumor or head injury

carousel_items_processed.orig: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Prednisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Prednisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

description_processed.orig: If you take Prednisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Prednisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: Its rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposis sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

description_processed.orig: Its rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposis sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

description_processed.orig: Prednisone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Prednisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Prednisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your childs height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your childs height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Prednisone to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Taking Prednisone if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Prednisone to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers
Taking Prednisone with other medicine that can cause stomach problems

description_processed.orig: Taking Prednisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

points.name: Congestive heart failure in susceptible patients
Aseptic necrosis of femoral and humeral heads
Peptic ulcer with possible perforation and hemorrhage
May suppress reactions to skin tests
Negative nitrogen balance due to protein
